availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Eagle (Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and police judge)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and police judge. Jackson County, Tennessee, native. Son of John Eakle and Rachael Eakle. Married to Elizabeth Chism Eagle in Monroe County, Kentucky, on January 8, 1857. Father of Molly A. Eagle, John H. Eagle, and Alonzo C. Eagle. Farmer in Macon County, Tennessee, in 1850. Merchant in Monroe County, Kentucky, in 1860. Police judge in Monroe County in 1862. Merchant in Barren County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Macon County, District 6, p. 165B-166A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Tompkinsville, p. 189.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Tompkinsville, p. 211B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Barren County, KY, February 1864, p. 105.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994049, Monroe County Marriages.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Monroe County Administrators Bonds, 1885-1901, p. 195.
"Henry Eagle (1830-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial #14001689, accessed August 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14001689.
KYR-0001-031-0085.
